question: The scATAC-seq data will be sparse because?

answers.answer: scATAC-seq protocol is not entirely standardized yet
answers.feedback: Not quite. scATAC-seq protocol is robust and has higher reproducibility.

answers.answer: A sufficient number of single-cell profiles is lacking
answers.feedback: Not quite. There are sufficient number of single-cell profiles available to create robust aggregate signal.

answers.answer: The chromatin accessibility at each base will be binary
answers.feedback: Yes. There are only two copies of DNA and regions with open chromatin with no reads due to loss of DNA material during the scATAC-seq protocol.

answers.answer: Chromatin cannot dynamically switch between transcriptionally active euchromatin and inactive heterochromatin
answers.feedback: Not quite. Chromatin is dynamic between active euchromatin and inactive heterochromatin.
